newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia Yield Spreads-Ruling the bloc.
newsitem.headline: Australia Yield Spreads-Ruling the bloc.

text.p: Australian bond yield spreads to the dollar bloc shrank sharply in the wake of today's 50 basis points official rate cut to 5.5 percent.

The Australian/U.S. 10-year bond yield spread sunk to around 75 basis points on the rate cut news, and to a three-year low, but showed some caution going into the close amid concerns that spread traders would either take profits or take fright by the unexpected move, analysts said.
Likewise, the three-year spread touched parity at one stage, and showed reluctance in going negative like one and two-year maturities.
Australian and U.S. official rates are now the same, and the real test will be if the Federal Reserve does tighten later this year after passing on a rate move earlier this week, analysts added.
